WE PROPOSE A 3-YEAR PROGRAM OF RESEARCH TO USE NASA AIRCRAFT DATA TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE SOURCES AND CHEMISTRY OF BIOGENIC NONMETHANE VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (BVOCS) OVER THE EASTERN US, AND THE IMPLICATIONS FOR ATMOSPHERIC OXIDANTS AND AEROSOLS. PARTICULAR FOCUS WILL BE ON ISOPRENE, THE DOMINANT BVOC, AND ON THE SEAC4RS AIRCRAFT CAMPAIGN (AUG-SEP 2013), WHICH INCLUDED AN UNPRECEDENTED PAYLOAD FOR TESTING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF ISOPRENE CHEMISTRY. WE WILL ALSO USE DATA FROM THE ICARTT AIRCRAFT CAMPAIGN (JUL-AUG 2004) TO EXAMINE DECADAL TRENDS DRIVEN BY CHANGES IN ANTHROPOGENIC NOX AND SOX EMISSIONS. WE WILL EXPLOIT THE OBSERVATIONS FROM THE AIRCRAFT TOGETHER WITH GROUND-BASED NETWORKS TO BETTER INTERPRET SATELLITE OBSERVATIONS OF FORMALDEHYDE (HCHO) AS CONSTRAINTS ON ISOPRENE EMISSION, AND OF AEROSOL OPTICAL DEPTH (AOD) AS CONSTRAINTS ON AEROSOL SOURCES AND SURFACE CONCENTRATIONS. OUR WORK WILL INVOLVE SIMULATIONS OF THE ENSEMBLE OF DATA USING THE GEOS-CHEM CHEMICAL TRANSPORT MODEL (CTM) WITH 0.25OX0.3125O HORIZONTAL RESOLUTION OVER NORTH AMERICA. WE WILL TARGET THE FOLLOWING RESEARCH QUESTIONS: 1.CAN CURRENT CHEMICAL MECHANISMS IMPLEMENTED IN CTMS SUCCESSFULLY DESCRIBE BVOC CHEMISTRY AS OBSERVED IN SEAC4RS, AND IF NOT HOW CAN THESE MECHANISMS BE IMPROVED? 2.HOW CAN SEAC4RS OBSERVATIONS IMPROVE THE INTERPRETATION OF HCHO OBSERVATIONS FROM SPACE FOR CONSTRAINING ISOPRENE EMISSIONS? 3.HOW CAN SEAC4RS OBSERVATIONS IMPROVE THE INTERPRETATION OF AOD OBSERVATIONS FROM SPACE FOR CONSTRAINING AEROSOL SOURCES AND SURFACE CONCENTRATIONS? 4.DOES COMPARISON BETWEEN ICARTT AND SEAC4RS REVEAL TRENDS IN BVOC CHEMISTRY AND RELATED AEROSOL FORMATION DRIVEN BY CHANGES IN NOX AND SOX EMISSIONS, AND WHAT ARE THE IMPLICATIONS FOR THE INTERPRETATION OF LONG-TERM RECORDS OF HCHO FROM SPACE?

WE WILL ESTIMATE THE AIR-SEA FLUXES OF LATENT HEAT, SENSIBLE HEAT, AND MOMENTUM, AS WELL AS MEASURE OCEAN SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE TEMPERATURE, SALINITY AND VELOCITY IN SUPPORT OF THE SPURS-2 OCEAN SALINITY FIELD CAMPAIGN. THE PRIMARY GOAL WILL BE ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF TERMS IN THE EQUATION GOVERNING THE EVOLUTION OF UPPER-OCEAN SALINITY, LEADING TO IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF PROCESSES AFFECTING BOTH THE LARGE-SCALE SALINITY FIELD AND THE SHALLOW, HIGH-FREQUENCY VARIATIONS IN SURFACE SALINITY. THE LARGER GOAL IS DIAGNOSING THE FACTORS CONTROLLING THE FRESH POOL OF THE NORTHEASTERN TROPICAL PACIFIC. MEASUREMENTS WILL BE OBTAINED BY DEPLOYMENT OF TWO OCEANOGRAPHIC SURFACE MOORINGS ON 125W NEAR 9N AND 10N FOR ONE YEAR, NEAR THE LOCATION OF MAXIMUM PRECIPITATION IN THE PACIFIC INTER-TROPICAL CONVERGENCE ZONE (ITCZ). INVESTIGATORS FROM THE WOODS HOLE OCEANOGRAPHIC INSTITUTION (WHOI) WILL DEPLOY A HEAVILY INSTRUMENTED MOORING AND BUOY AT 10N, 125W. THE BUOY WILL CARRY STATE-OF-THE-ART INSTRUMENTS FOR MEASURING SURFACE METEOROLOGY, INCIDENT SOLAR AND INFRARED RADIATION, AND SUBSURFACE TEMPERATURE, SALINITY, AND VELOCITY, WITH SPECIFIC FOCUS ON MAKING ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF THE SURFACE FRESHWATER FLUXES (EVAPORATION AND PRECIPITATION) AND THE SUBSURFACE HORIZONTAL TRANSPORT OF SALT. THE SURFACE LATENT HEAT, SENSIBLE HEAT, AND MOMENTUM FLUXES WILL BE ESTIMATED USING BULK FORMULAS THAT RELATE THE TURBULENT FLUXES IN TERMS OF MORE EASILY MEASURED MEAN VARIABLES (E.G., 1-HR AVERAGE HUMIDITY, TEMPERATURE AND WIND SPEED) THROUGH TRANSFER COEFFICIENTS. ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF THE EVAPORATION RATE, PROPORTIONAL TO THE SURFACE LATENT HEAT FLUX, ARE OF PARTICULAR IMPORTANCE TO THIS PROGRAM. THE WHOI MOORING WILL ALSO CARRY ATMOSPHERIC TURBULENCE INSTRUMENTS TO MAKE DIRECT MEASUREMENTS OF THE SURFACE MOMENTUM FLUX AND LATENT AND SENSIBLE HEAT FLUXES. IN ADDITION TO INSTRUMENTS FOR ACCURATE QUANTIFICATION OF AIR-SEA FLUXES, THE MOORING AND BUOY WILL ALSO CARRY A FULL COMPLEMENT OF OTHER INSTRUMENTS THAT WILL ALLOW INSIGHT INTO THE DYNAMICS AND PROCESSES AFFECTING SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE SALINITY, INCLUDING: DENSELY SPACED (2 M) MEASUREMENTS OF T AND S NEAR THE SURFACE WITH TEMPORAL RESOLUTION OF MINUTES, VERTICAL PROFILES OF T, S, AND VELOCITY SPANNING THE UPPER 1500 M (WITH HIGHER RESOLUTION ABOVE 200 M), SURFACE-WAVE MEASUREMENTS, AND A SPECIAL FOCUS ON PRECIPITATION MEASUREMENTS. A PACIFIC MARINE ENVIRONMENTAL LABORATORY (PMEL) PRAWLER PROFILING MOORING AND SURFACE BUOY AT 9N, 125W WILL MEASURE NEARLY CONTINUOUS VERTICAL PROFILES OF TEMPERATURE AND SALINITY FROM 10-500 M AND WILL CARRY A SURFACE METEOROLOGY PACKAGE TO MEASURE PRECIPITATION, WIND, AIR TEMPERATURE, HUMIDITY, AND BAROMETRIC PRESSURE. THE PMEL MOORING WILL ALSO MEASURE SEA SURFACE TEMPERATURE AND SALINITY. THIS PROJECT FEATURES A SPECIAL FOCUS ON PRECIPITATION. THE PMEL AND WHOI MOORINGS WILL CARRY MULTIPLE INSTRUMENTS FOR MEASURING PRECIPITATION, INCLUDING CONVENTIONAL RAIN GAUGES AND SUBSURFACE HYDROPHONES THAT WILL BE PREPARED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTONS APPLIED PHYSICS LABORATORY (APL-UW). IN ADDITION, OUR TEAM INCLUDES ATMOSPHERIC SCIENTISTS WHO WILL WORK TO INTERPRET THE IN SITU AND SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS OF RAINFALL AND CLOUD PROPERTIES AND PROVIDE GUIDANCE TO THE LARGER SPURS-2 GROUP ON THE SPATIO-TEMPORAL SCALES OF THE PRECIPITATING SYSTEMS AND THE BROADER SYNOPTIC WEATHER CONTEXT.

IGF::OT::IGF INTEGRATED WORKPLACE MANAGEMENT SOFTWARE (IWMS)

THE ASTRO-H MISSION, NOW UNDER DEVELOPMENT BY NASA'S GODDARD SPACE FLIGHT CENTER (GSFC) AND THE JAPANESE AEROSPACE EXPLORATION AGENCY (JAXA) FOR LAUNCH IN LATE 2015 OR EARLY 2016, WILL BE THE PREMIER NEW X-RAY OBSERVATORY OF THIS DECADE. THE ASTRO-H SOFT X-RAY SPECTROMETER (SXS) WILL PROVIDE SPATIALLY RESOLVED SPECTROSCOPY WITH UNPRECEDENTED SPECTRAL RESOLUTION, AND WILL REVOLUTIONIZE THE STUDY OF EXTENDED XRAY SOURCES RANGING FROM SUPERNOVA REMNANTS TO CLUSTERS OF GALAXIES. THE SXS WILL BE COMPLEMENTED ON ASTRO-H BY A WIDE-FIELD, SOFT X-RAY CCD IMAGER (SXI) AND A PAIR OF HARD X-RAY IMAGERS (HXI).IN CONSIDERATION OF NASA'S CRITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS TO ASTRO-H INSTRUMENTATION, INCLUDING KEY COMPONENTS OF THE SXS AS WELL AS X-RAY TELESCOPE (XRT) MIRRORS FOR THE SXS AND SXI, THE US SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY WILL RECEIVE RIGHTS TO PROPOSE FOR A SIGNIFICANT FRACTION OF ASTRO-H OBSERVING TIME. IN ORDER TO ASSURE THE SCIENTIFIC QUALITY AND READY AVAILABILITY OF THESE DATA TO THE COMMUNITY, NASA'S GSFC HAS ALSO ASSUMED A LEADING ROLE IN COORDINATION OF GROUND AND FLIGHT CALIBRATION, AND IN DEVELOPMENT OF GROUND PROCESSING SOFTWARE FOR ALL INSTRUMENTS ON ASTRO-H. HERE MKI PROPOSES TO SUPPORT THE ASTRO-H TEAM AT GSFC AS IT PLANS CALIBRATION AND GROUND SOFTWARE FOR ASTRO-H, AND AS IT SUPPORTS ASTRO-H AFTER LAUNCH. MKI'S UNIQUE QUALIFICATIONS FOR THIS ROLE, AND THE PROPOSED STATEMENT OF WORK, SCHEDULE, AND BUDGET ARE DESCRIBED IN TURN.

doc.ContractDescription: IN BINARY SYSTEMS AT SMALL SEPARATION, THE DIFFERENTIAL GRAVITY FROM ONE BODY CAN INDUCE A SIGNIFICANT TIDE IN THE OTHER. THE DISSIPATION OF THE TIDE WILL, IN TIME, SYNCHRONIZE THE ROTATION AND CIRCULARIZE THE ORBIT. DESPITE DECADES OF INTENSE OBSERVATIONAL AND THEORETICAL STUDY, THE PHYSICAL MECHANISM FOR TIDAL DISSIPATION IN FLUID OBJECTS IS NOT WELL UNDERSTOOD. PHYSICALLY MOTIVATED THEORIES OF TIDES ARE CRUCIAL TO UNDERSTAND THE ORIGIN OF CLOSE BINARIES, THEIR SUBSEQUENT ORBITAL EVOLUTION, AND THERMAL EVOLUTION DUE TO TIDAL HEATING. THEORIES OF TIDAL DISSIPATION FIND APPLICATION IN A BROAD RANGE OF NASA SCIENCE, FROM THE SURVIVAL OF EXOPLANETS, TO THE CIRCULARIZATION OF BINARIES, TO THE FATE OF COMPACT BINARIES WHICH ARE STRONG GRAVITATIONAL WAVE SOURCES. OUR PROPOSED RESEARCH IS ESPECIALLY RELEVANT TO THE KEPLER, SPITZER, AND SWIFT NASA MISSIONS. PREVIOUS INVESTIGATIONS OF TIDAL DISSIPATION ASSUMED THE FLOW IS LAMINAR; FOR SIMPLICITY, THEY SOLVED THE LINEARIZED FLUID EQUATIONS. MUCH OF THE FOCUS WAS ON LINEAR DAMPING MECHANISMS, SUCH AS RADIATIVE DIFFUSION OR TURBULENT VISCOSITY ARISING IN CONVECTION ZONES. SUCH STUDIES FAIL BY ORDERS OF MAGNITUDE TO PRODUCE THE LEVEL OF DISSIPATION NEEDED TO EXPLAIN THE OBSERVED SYSTEMS. IN A RECENT STUDY, THE PI AND CO-I DEVELOPED A COMPREHENSIVE GENERAL THEORY OF NONLINEAR TIDES. THEY SHOWED THAT THE LINEAR TIDAL FLOW IS UNSTABLE OVER A BROAD RANGE OF IMPORTANT PARAMETER SPACE, LEADING TO THE GROWTH OF SMALL SCALE WAVES. IN ESSENCE, THE LAMINAR FLOW OFTEN ASSUMED DOES NOT EXIST FOR THE PARAMETER RANGE OVER WHICH IT IS EMPLOYED. NONLINEAR DAMPING FROM THIS TIDALLY-INDUCED TURBULENCE PROVIDES A PROMISING ALTERNATIVE TO CONVENTIONAL LINEAR DAMPING MECHANISMS AND MAY HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON THE EVOLUTION OF CLOSE BINARIES. HAVING DEVELOPED THE GENERAL FORMALISM FOR STUDYING NONLINEAR TIDES, THE PI AND CO-I PROPOSE TO INVESTIGATE HOW NONLINEAR DISSIPATION INFLUENCES THE ORBITAL, SPIN, AND STRUCTURAL EVOLUTION OF A VARIETY OF BINARY SYSTEMS. THEY HAVE ALSO DEVELOPED A TWO-DIMENSIONAL CODE TO STUDY THE LINEAR RESPONSE OF A ROTATING STAR PLANET TO THE APPLIED TIDE, WITH WHICH INERTIAL WAVE EXCITATION CAN BE COMPUTED. THE PRIMARY APPLICATIONS OF THE CALCULATIONS ARE INSPIRALING COMPACT BINARIES CONTAINING NEUTRON STARS, CLOSE-IN GAS GIANT EXTRASOLAR PLANETS, AND SOLAR-TYPE BINARIES. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH WILL SHED LIGHT ON LONGSTANDING PUZZLES IN THE EVOLUTION OF STELLAR BINARIES AND EXTRASOLAR PLANETARY SYSTEMS. IT WILL ALSO ELUCIDATE THE IMPACT OF TIDAL DISSIPATION ON THE HEATING AND ORBITAL EVOLUTION OF INSPIRALING NEUTRON STARS, WHICH HAS IMPORTANT IMPLICATIONS FOR THEIR ELECTROMAGNETIC AND GRAVITATIONAL WAVE EMISSION.

OTHER FUNCTION - IN VITRO ASSESSMENT FOR ANTIMICROBIAL ACTIVITY

IGF::OT::IGF NASA RESEARCH ANNOUNCEMENT AWARD. OCEAN BOTTOM PRESSURE IS A FUNDAMENTAL VARIABLE OF THE EARTH SYSTEM, AS IT RELATES TO CHANGES IN THE OCEAN MEAN MASS AND FRESHWATER CONTENT, HORIZONTAL MASS REDISTRIBUTIONS AND ASSOCIATED CURRENTS, AND OTHER ESSENTIAL DIAGNOSTICS ON LAND ICE, THE HYDROLOGICAL CYCLE AND THE EARTH'S ENERGY BALANCE. DATA COLLECTED BY GRACE AND ITS FOLLOW-ON MISSION PROVIDE A MOUNTING RECORD OF OBP FIELDS WITH UNPRECEDENTED GLOBAL SPATIAL COVERAGE, BUT MANY CHALLENGES REMAIN IN THEIR PROCESSING AND USE OF SCIENTIFIC ANALYSES. IN THIS PROPOSAL, WE PLAN TO MAKE SYNERGISTIC USE OF AVAILABLE AND FUTURE GRAVITY DATA, OTHER SATELLITE AND IN SITU OBSERVATIONS, AND MODELS TO LEARN ABOUT THE OCEAN AND ITS ROLE IN EARTH'S CLIMATE, GRAVITY AND ROTATION.

BLANKET PURCHASE AGREEMENT (BPA) CALL ORDER TITLE: ENERGY STAR MEDIA&COMMUNICATION - COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL BRANCH THE PURPOSE OF MODIFICATION NO. 6 IS TO ADD INCREMENTAL FUNDING; MODIFY THE CEILING PRICE; REVISED SOW; AND MODIFY THE CONTRACT ADMINISTRATION REPRESENTATIVE CLAUSE. THE PURPOSE OF THIS CALL ORDER IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO ENGAGE TENANTS AND EMPLOYEES IN SAVING ENERGY IN THEIR WORKPLACES AND TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR ENHANCING EXISTING RECOGNITION AND DEVELOPING NEW ENERGY STAR RECOGNITION OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARTNERS, AS WELL AS PROMOTING NEW PROGRAM OFFERINGS.
